diagnosis.final_diagnosis: perforated diverticulitis, pneumonia RLL, bacteremia due to Fusobacterium nucleatum
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute abdominal pain and was hypotensive, which led to further evaluation. Imaging revealed moderate amount of ascites and possible sigmoid diverticulosis, consistent with diverticulitis. The pneumonia was noted on discharge diagnosis indicating its relevance. The patient had confusion and laboratory findings suggested infection, supporting the diagnosis of bacteremia.
